00023 
00024 #ifndef VMIOS_ATTRS_H
00025 #define VMIOS_ATTRS_H
00026 
00027 #include "vmi/vmiAttrs.h"
00028 #include "vmi/vmiParameters.h"
00029 #include "vmi/vmiTyperefs.h"
00030 
00031 
00033 // VMIOS CONSTRUCTOR AND DESTRUCTOR
00035 
00036 //
00037 // Model constructor
00038 //
00039 #define VMIOS_CONSTRUCTOR_FN(_NAME) void _NAME( \
00040     vmiProcessorP processor,      \
00041     vmiosObjectP  object,         \
00042     void         *parameterValues \
00043 )
00044 typedef VMIOS_CONSTRUCTOR_FN((*vmiosConstructorFn));
00045 
00046 //
00047 // Model destructor
00048 //
00049 #define VMIOS_DESTRUCTOR_FN(_NAME) void _NAME( \
00050     vmiProcessorP processor,    \
00051     vmiosObjectP  object        \
00052 )
00053 typedef VMIOS_DESTRUCTOR_FN((*vmiosDestructorFn));
00054 
00055 
00057 // SAVE / RESTORE
00059 
00060 //
00061 // This callback function type is used to implement model save
00062 //
00063 #define VMIOS_SAVE_STATE_FN(_NAME) void _NAME( \
00064     vmiosObjectP    object,         \
00065     vmiSaveContextP cxt             \
00066 )
00067 typedef VMIOS_SAVE_STATE_FN((*vmiosSaveStateFn));
00068 
00069 //
00070 // This callback function type is used to implement model restore
00071 //
00072 #define VMIOS_RESTORE_STATE_FN(_NAME) void _NAME( \
00073     vmiosObjectP       object,      \
00074     vmiRestoreContextP cxt          \
00075 )
00076 typedef VMIOS_RESTORE_STATE_FN((*vmiosRestoreStateFn));
00077 
00078 
00080 // TYPES USED TO DEFINE INTERCEPTIONS
00082 
00083 //
00084 // This defines the function type called for an intercepted function.
00085 // 'atOpaqueIntercept' is True if the current address is opaquely intercepted
00086 // (not necessarily by this callback) - useful for transparent intercepts that
00087 // decode instructions and therefore need to know whether the current
00088 // instruction is truly going to be executed
00089 //
00090 #define VMIOS_INTERCEPT_FN(_NAME) void _NAME( \
00091     vmiProcessorP processor,        \
00092     vmiosObjectP  object,           \
00093     Addr          thisPC,           \
00094     const char   *context,          \
00095     void         *userData,         \
00096     Bool          atOpaqueIntercept \
00097 )
00098 typedef VMIOS_INTERCEPT_FN((*vmiosInterceptFn));
00099 
00100 //
00101 // Intercept attributes (bitmask)
00102 //
00103 typedef enum vmiosInterceptAttrE {
00104     OSIA_NONE   = 0x0,              // no special attributes
00105     OSIA_OPAQUE = 0x1,              // opaque intercept (otherwise transparent)
00106     OSIA_THREAD = 0x2,              // run in thread (otherwise synchronous)
00107 } vmiosInterceptAttr;
00108 
00109 //
00110 // Intercept table entry
00111 //
00112 typedef struct vmiosInterceptDescS {
00113     const char        *name;        // for interception by name
00114     Addr               simAddress;  // for interception by address
00115     vmiosInterceptAttr attrs;       // intercepted function attributes
00116     vmiosInterceptFn   interceptCB; // interception callback
00117     void              *userData;    // client-specific data pointer
00118     Bool               skipPrologue;// Use gdb to find the prologue (not implemented yet)
00119 } vmiosInterceptDesc;
00120 
00121 
00123 // MORPH OVERRIDE CALLBACK
00125 
00126 //
00127 // This routine may be used to override the default behavior of the morpher for
00128 // a particular instruction. If the instruction should be overridden, the
00129 // function should return a vmiosInterceptFn function for the required
00130 // interception and set byref arguments 'opaque' (True->opaque, False->
00131 // transparent) 'context' (a user-defined context string) and 'userData'
00132 // (an application-specific argument passed uninterpreted to the intercept
00133 // function); otherwise, it should return NULL.
00134 //
00135 #define VMIOS_MORPH_FN(_NAME) vmiosInterceptFn _NAME( \
00136     vmiProcessorP processor,    \
00137     vmiosObjectP  object,       \
00138     Addr          thisPC,       \
00139     Uns8          inDelaySlot,  \
00140     Bool          firstInBlock, \
00141     Bool         *opaque,       \
00142     const char  **context,      \
00143     void        **userData      \
00144 )
00145 typedef VMIOS_MORPH_FN((*vmiosMorphFn));
00146 
00147 //
00148 // This routine may be used to override the default size of an instruction. If
00149 // the size should be overridden, the function should supply the next program
00150 // counter using the 'nextPC' byref argument and return True; otherwise, it
00151 // should return False.
00152 //
00153 #define VMIOS_NEXT_PC_FN(_NAME) Bool _NAME( \
00154     vmiProcessorP processor,    \
00155     vmiosObjectP  object,       \
00156     Addr          thisPC,       \
00157     Addr         *nextPC        \
00158 )
00159 typedef VMIOS_NEXT_PC_FN((*vmiosNextPCFn));
00160 
00161 
00163 // FORMALS
00165 
00166 #define VMIOS_PARAM_SPEC_FN(_NAME) vmiParameterP _NAME( \
00167     vmiosObjectP  object,   \
00168     vmiParameterP prev      \
00169 )
00170 typedef VMIOS_PARAM_SPEC_FN((*vmiosParamSpecFn));
00171 
00172 //
00173 // Type of function called by simulator to get the size of the parameter value
00174 // table
00175 //
00176 #define VMIOS_PARAM_TABLE_SIZE_FN(_NAME) Uns32 _NAME ( \
00177     vmiosAttrCP plugin  \
00178 )
00179 typedef VMIOS_PARAM_TABLE_SIZE_FN((*vmiosParamValueSizeFn));
00180 
00181 
00183 // DISASSEMBLE OVERRIDE CALLBACK
00185 
00186 //
00187 // Return a string representing the disassembled instruction at the passed
00188 // address
00189 //
00190 #define VMIOS_DISASSEMBLE_FN(_NAME) const char *_NAME( \
00191     vmiProcessorP  processor,   \
00192     vmiosObjectP   object,      \
00193     Addr           thisPC,      \
00194     vmiDisassAttrs attrs        \
00195 )
00196 typedef VMIOS_DISASSEMBLE_FN((*vmiosDisassFn));
00197 
00198 
00199 //
00200 // This structure defines attributes for semihosting support
00201 //
00202 typedef struct vmiosAttrS {
00203 
00205     // VERSION
00207 
00208     const char           *versionString;    // version string (THIS MUST BE FIRST)
00209     vmiModelType          modelType;        // type of model (enum)
00210     const char           *packageName;      // package name
00211     Uns32                 objectSize;       // size in bytes of VMIOS object
00212 
00214     // MODEL STATUS
00216 
00217     vmiVisibility         visibility;       // model visibility (enum)
00218     vmiReleaseStatus      releaseStatus;    // model release status (enum)
00219 
00221     // SAVE/RESTORE ROUTINES
00223 
00224     vmiosSaveStateFn      saveCB;           // model state save callback
00225     vmiosRestoreStateFn   restoreCB;        // model state restore callback
00226 
00228     // CONSTRUCTOR/DESTRUCTOR ROUTINES
00230 
00231     vmiosConstructorFn    constructorCB;    // constructor
00232     vmiosDestructorFn     destructorCB;     // destructor
00233 
00235     // INSTRUCTION INTERCEPT ROUTINES
00237 
00238     vmiosMorphFn          morphCB;          // morph override callback
00239     vmiosNextPCFn         nextPCCB;         // get next instruction address
00240     vmiosDisassFn         disCB;            // disassemble instruction
00241 
00243     // FORMAL PARAMETERS iterators to find parameters accepted by this model
00245 
00246     vmiosParamSpecFn      paramSpecsCB;     // callback for next formal param
00247     vmiosParamValueSizeFn paramValueSizeCB; // callback to get size of table
00248 
00250     // Model VLNV
00252 
00253     vmiVlnvInfo           vlnv;              // vendor/library/name/version
00254 
00256     // ADDRESS INTERCEPT DEFINITIONS
00258 
00259     vmiosInterceptDesc    intercepts[];     // null-terminated intercept list
00260 
00261 } vmiosAttr;
00262 
00263 
00264 #endif
